newsitem.title: USA: U.S. HEADLINE STOCKS - Issues to Watch - Sept 13.
newsitem.headline: U.S. HEADLINE STOCKS - Issues to Watch - Sept 13.

text.p: -- HealthPlan Services Corp said it agreed to buy Health Risk Management Inc for about $80 million in cash and stock. Each share of Health Risk will be swapped for $9.69 cash and, on a tax-free basis, 0.360208 share of HealthPlan.
The deal values each Health Risk share at about $17.75. Shares of HealthPlan closed up 2/8 at at 22-3/8 on Thursday and shares of Health Risk closed at 15-1/2.
-- Compuserve said it expects to post a second quarter loss of up to $0.15 a share. The stock closed at 14.
-- Time Warner Inc and Turner Broadcasting System said in an internal memo that layoffs are expected now that the merger of the two cable companies is complete.
-- AMP Inc said its third quarter earnings should be $0.45 to $0.50 a share, below its previous expectations, due to price erosion and a strong U.S. dollar. AMP closed at 39.
-- International Rectifier said it expects lower earnings for the September quarter. It closed at 13-5/8.
